author: 小浪财讯
title: AI人工智能ETF（512930）涨2.37%，半日成交额1.00亿元|人工智能_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
7月31日，截止午间收盘，AI人工智能ETF（512930）涨2.37%，报1.555元，成交额1.00亿元。AI人工智能ETF（512930）重仓股方面， 中际旭创 截止午盘涨8.07%， 新易盛 涨4.76%， 寒武纪 涨3.11%， 科大讯飞 涨2.87%， 豪威集团 跌1.48%， 中科曙光 涨0.38%， 海康威视 跌0.70%， 澜起科技 跌0.61%， 金山办公 涨5.89%， 浪潮信息 涨3.22%。
AI人工智能ETF（512930）业绩比较基准为中证人工智能主题指数收益率，管理人为平安基金管理有限公司，基金经理为刘洁倩，成立（2019-07-12）以来回报为76.09%，近一个月回报为9.78%。

author: @wbkotv
title: Missing hiker found alive after being lost for 10 days in mountains
text: Missing hiker found alive after being lost for 10 days in mountains SANTA CRUZ COUNTY, Calif. (KSBW) - A missing hiker was finally rescued after he was lost for 10 days in the Santa Cruz Mountains of California. The 34-year-old man was only going for a three-hour hike when he disappeared. “I didn’t bring anything because I thought I was doing a three-hour hike to go to work,” Lukas McClish, the rescued hiker, said. He was lost in the woods for nine nights and 10 days, shirtless with only a flashlight and folding scissors. It would be more than a week before the raggedy-looking hiker would be found. “So, I kind of just hiked. Each day, I go up a canyon, down a canyon to the next waterfall, sit down by the waterfall, drink water out of my boot,” Lukas McClish recalled. It was a Tuesday when Lukas McClish went for a hike in Boulder Creek and ended up getting lost. “I felt comfortable the whole time I was out there. I wasn’t worried about it,” Lukas McClish said. “I had a mountain lion that was following me, but it was cool. It kept its distances. I think it was just somebody watching over me.” The problem was that Lukas McClish didn’t tell anyone where he was going. By the time Father’s Day rolled around on Sunday, his family started worrying and filed a missing person’s report. The search was on then. “Some nights, although, I just had to trust God that he was going to be OK, and that was hard to do some nights when we would go to bed at night because I would worry about where he was, where he was sleeping and how cold he was and where he was if he was alive,” Diane McClish, the hiker’s mother, said. Lukas McClish drank from water from creeks, ate wild berries and slept on a wet bed of leaves all while yelling for help and thinking of his next meal. “‘Just help. Help, I’m over here.’ Or, ‘Is anybody out there?’” Lukas McClish remembered saying while he was lost. “I want a burrito or a taco bowl. That’s what I thought about every day when I, after the first five days, when I started to kind of realize that I might be in over my head.” But on Thursday afternoon, someone finally heard his cries for help. The Boulder Creek Fire Department deployed a drone and spotted his location. A K-9 tracked him down and Lukas McClish was escorted out of a remote canyon, finally reunited with family. “Met a lot of people because I had more people come to me and tell me how much they love my son and how they just hoped that we would find him,” Diane McClish said. “I didn’t realize that so many people in this town love Luke.” Fortunately, Lukas McClish had no major injuries. Copyright 2024 KSBW via CNN Newsource. All rights reserved.

author: Gabriela Vatu
title: Start the new year with a lifetime Windows 11 Pro license for just $40
text:
Start the new year with a lifetime Windows 11 Pro license for just $40 By Gabriela Vatu Published 4 hours ago Save almost 80% on a new Windows 11 Pro license today.
Readers like you help support Pocket-lint. When you make a purchase using links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Read More.
Windows 11 Pro $40 $199 Save $159 Upgrading your PC to the newest Windows version doesn't have to cost an absolute fortune if you get your key from the right place. Stack Social, for instance, has the software available with 79% off.
$40 at StackSocial Looking to keep your computer running smoothly? Consider upgrading to Windows 11 Pro. With its sleek design, improved speed, and enhanced security features, Windows 11 Pro is the operating system you need. And now, you can get a Windows 11 Pro license from StackSocial for just $40.

The addition of widgets makes it even more convenient to access information with just a click. Plus, the snap layouts feature facilitates multitasking by allowing you to use multiple apps on the same screen.
Related Did your Windows 11 taskbar just disappear? Here's why and how to fix it The Windows 11 taskbar is a vital part of everyone's workflow. But it can go missing sometimes. Here's how to troubleshoot and restore it. But it's not just about aesthetics. Windows 11 Pro introduces new security measures, including a simplified password manager and ransomware protection, so you can feel confident that your data is protected. There are other features, such as enhanced biometrics login for encrypted authorization whenever logging in or installing apps. For your kids, the Smart App Control will help check the apps installed to make sure they're safe to use.
Normally priced at $200, getting a Windows 11 Pro key for only $40 is an absolute steal, so you really shouldn't miss out on this limited-time offer from StackSocial. Simply set up an account, order your license, and receive your key within minutes. Also, if you're interested in other version of the Windows software, know that that Windows 11 Home and Windows 10 Pro are also available for the same $40 right now. These licenses last for a lifetime, so you won't need to pay for them again, which is another benefit of buying from StackSocial at this point.

author: Syndicated Content
title: Nicaragua arrests two high-ranking Catholic priests with close ties to cardinal
text:
By Ismael Lopez
SAN JOSE (Reuters) – Nicaraguan police detained on Thursday two senior Catholic priests who are close to the country’s top church leader, a person with knowledge of the matter said, raising to at least six the number of clergymen detained this week.
The source, who declined to be named for fear of arrest, said the two priests were detained for publicly praying for jailed Bishop Rolando Alvarez, the most prominent critic of President Daniel Ortega.
Local media outlet Confidencial named the priests as Carlos Aviles and Hector Treminio, and noted that their arrest brings to at least six the number of priests detained over the past week, adding that two of the clerics had already been released.
The government’s press office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Over the past few years, Ortega’s government has targeted members of the Catholic church, a crackdown officials have in the past said was needed to punish treasonous behavior or other alleged crimes.
Aviles is the second-highest ranking cleric in the Archdiocese of Managua, led by Cardinal Leopoldo Brenes, while Treminio is its treasurer.
Alvarez, the bishop of Matagalpa, forcefully criticized the government’s deadly response to mass protests that broke out in 2018, and was convicted of treason and sentenced to a 26-year prison term earlier this year.
Last week, police arrested Bishop Isidro Mora of the Siuna diocese, making him the second bishop to be detained after Alvarez’s detention in 2022.
Many of the latest clergymen detained were arrested because they publicly offered prayers for Alvarez, according to the source and local media, but the government has not issued any statements explaining the priests’ alleged crimes.
Nicaraguan Bishop Silvio Baez, who has been living in exile in Florida since 2019 and is the second-ranking leader of the archdiocese, called for the priests to be released.
“I ask God to protect them and that they be freed immediately!” wrote in a post on X on Thursday.
According to exiled Nicaraguan researcher Martha Patricia Molina, who publishes records of what she describes as the persecution of the Catholic Church under Ortega, the number of bishops, priests and seminarians behind bars in the country currently stands at nine.
(Reporting by Ismael Lopez; Writing by David Alire Garcia and Miral Fahmy)

author: @Midilibre
title: Les Estivales, un manifestation très suivie!
text:
Les Estivales, un manifestation très suivie!
Chaque lundi, en juillet et en août, la place du marché accueille les Estivales, une manifestation dont le succès ne se dément pas depuis sa création en 2013 !
Lundi 21 juillet, dès 19 h 30, les tables installées par la municipalité étaient prises d’assaut ! Après l’installation, il ne reste plus qu’à choisir son menu, les offres gastronomiques étant fort variées : du stand de fruits de mer superbement achalandé, à la viande et charcuterie proposées par le Mas de Sire, de l’aligot aux plats libanais, des escargots de la Vaunage aux glaces artisanales sans oublier des feuilletés plus classiques et bien sûr les beignets d’oignons doux des Cévennes qui se méritent car ils connaissent un grand succès, tout le monde peut trouver son bonheur !
Il règne une atmosphère extrêmement conviviale autour des stands de dégustation de vin : ce lundi les 3 producteurs exposants étaient : la cave de Souvignargues, les Cambeaux de Sardan et le domaine Les Bruyères de Sommières. Les vignerons échangent avec plaisir avec les visiteurs et expliquent leurs créations et leurs assemblages.
Tout ceci avec une animation musicale très agréable…
Les Estivales-place du marché-tous les lundis de 18h30 à 23 heures.
Correspondant Midi Libre : 06 81 06 53 60

author: Saleen Martin
title: 'May this keep you safe from harm': WWII era Bible returned to New York veteran's family
text: Lost and found: Forgotten WWII-era Bible finds its way home to fallen airman's family [Saleen Martin](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7245115001/saleen-martin/) During World War II, a woman bought three brothers Bibles to protect their hearts and guide them as they set out for battle. The Bible had a metal cover on the front with the inscription “May this keep you safe from harm." Two of the brothers made it home, while the other, Lt. Edsel J. McKnight of the United States Army Air Forces, was shot down off the coast of France. His Bible was mailed to the family but was lost sometime after. This month, his family finally got it back. Ava Coogan's family is from Albany, New York and they found the Bible in late December while going through their late matriarch’s belongings. On Jan. 11, Coogan met Lt. McKnight’s sister-in-law and returned the Bible to her, allowing her to put it back in its rightful place, next to the ones his brothers brought back home from war. ‘I kept playing with it and flipping through the pages’ Coogan’s uncle and mother found the Bible in a stack of books. Their mother, Rosanne Vartanian, died nearly 20 years ago but was a collector and loved garage sales. “It’s just so random that my grandmother had the urge to pick that up,” she said. “She bought random things. There was no rhyme or reason to it. It was with a stack of other books.” Coogan decided to research the Bible and found out soldiers often took them to war. Some can be found in museums. “The whole premise of it was that the metal cover on the front is like a hard shield,” Coogan told USA TODAY. “They would put it in their coat pockets … like the front breast pocket … that cover would protect their heart from bullets.” Lt. McKnight’s name was also written in the Bible, said Coogan, who was drawn to the Bible for some reason. She couldn’t put it down, she recalled. “I kept playing with it and flipping through the pages,” she said. She noticed that the Bible’s front cover had a slice in it, almost like something was underneath it. She examined it more closely and found a piece of paper folded up inside. She asked her uncle for help, who carefully used a butter knife to get the slip of paper out. Once they retrieved the piece of paper from under the Bible’s cover, they saw that it was a plea for the Bible’s safe return to an address not too far away. Although there was no area code, there was a phone number listed, so the family added their own area code and called. “I was just hoping for the best,” Coogan said. “We found out that number worked.” Lieutenant was shot down off the coast of France When Coogan's uncle called the number written in the note, he spoke to a woman named Fay, Lt. McKnight’s sister-in-law. The families organized a meetup on Jan. 11 to return the Bible to the McKnights, who are from Porter Corners, part of Saratoga County in eastern New York. Lt. McKnight served in the U.S. Air Force’s 365th Fighter Group and 388th Fighter Squadron. He was flying in a Thunderbolt fighter aircraft in 1944 when he was shot down off the coast of France, [online records](https://rafbeaulieu.co.uk/honouring-the-airmen-of-raf-beaulieu/) show. Fay told Coogan and her family that Lt. McKnight has two brothers. All three of the brothers served in WWII. Fay’s husband, Ray, said his Bible saved his life. “He got shot during the war and it hit where the Bible was, covering his heart, and the bullet went into his arm instead,” Coogan said. Once Lt. McKnight was killed, his belongings were shipped back home to the family. His sister-in-law had all three Bibles on a bookshelf on display. One day, the family was preparing to go to church. Her nephew borrowed the Bible, but knew it was so precious, the family decided to write a note with contact information in case it were ever lost. “He didn't lose it,” Coogan said. “He brought it back after church and I guess what happened is after someone passed in their family, they had an estate sale … and it just accidentally went out with a stack of books.” It ended up in Coogan’s grandmother’s hands, she said. Returning the Bible to the McKnight family was quite the enlightening experience, Coogan said. “That was really cool because that's when we kind of got to hear their story,” she said.

author: Новый День
title: Президент Сербии отказался подписать антироссийскую декларацию
text:
Президент Сербии Александр Вучич заявил, что не предавал Россию, несмотря на участие в саммите Украина – Юго-Восточная Европа и свое обещание сотрудничать с Украиной, и подчеркнул, что не подписал итоговую антироссийскую декларацию.
«Что и кого я предал? Россию? Чем? Тем, что приехал на саммит? Так я уже в четвертый раз на саммите Юго-Восточной Европы и Украины – и опять я единственный, кто не принял декларацию», – сказал Вучич (цитата по ТАСС), добавив, что в отличие от других Белград не поддерживает инициативы, направленные против России.
Президент Сербии обратил внимание, что ранее его критиковали за пророссийскую позицию, а теперь обвиняют в противоположном, и подчеркнул, что гордится независимой политикой Белграда. «Я горжусь политикой Сербии, нашей самостоятельностью, нашей независимостью, и мы будем продолжать это делать», – заявил Вучич.
Ранее президент Сербии выразил готовность участвовать в восстановлении украинских городов.
Одесса, Анастасия Смирнова
© 2025, РИА «Новый День»
topics: War, Conflict and Unrest->international military intervention

author: 小浪财讯
title: 工业互联ETF（159778）跌0.12%，半日成交额5.53万元|工业_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，工业互联ETF（159778）跌0.12%，报0.812元，成交额5.53万元。工业互联ETF（159778）重仓股方面， 比亚迪 截止午盘跌1.40%， 汇川技术 跌0.05%， 韦尔股份 涨0.27%， 北方华创 涨1.95%， 海康威视 跌1.12%， 宁德时代 跌1.13%， 国电南瑞 跌0.31%， 科大讯飞 跌0.55%， 工业富联 跌0.95%， 兆易创新 涨0.64%。
工业互联ETF（159778）业绩比较基准为中证工业互联网主题指数收益率，管理人为鹏华基金管理有限公司，基金经理为罗英宇，成立（2022-01-25）以来回报为-18.75%，近一个月回报为-2.39%。
